clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Decision Support System to Define 30 Day Adverse Clinical Events for Emergency Department Acute Coronary Syndromes
clinical_study.official_title: Development of Clinical Decision Support System to Define 30 Day Adverse Clinical Events (Non Fatal Myocardial Infarction, Cardiac Related Death or Coronary Intervention) for Patients Presenting to Emergency Department With Acute Coronary Syndrome

lead_sponsor.agency: Turkish Ministry of Health Izmir Teaching Hospital

clinical_study.source: Turkish Ministry of Health Izmir Teaching Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Acute coronary syndromes are among main complains for patients presenting to emergency department. Risk classification systems are used to classify patients to appropriate risks and help physicians manage diagnosis strategies and treatments. Purpose of this study is to develop a clinical decision support system for patients presenting to emergency department with the help of statistical machine learning.

detailed_description.textblock: Acute coronary syndromes are among main complains for patients presenting to emergency department and create a burden to emergency departments and hospitals. Risk classification systems were developed and used to classify patients to appropriate risk groups. According to risk classification, different diagnosis and treatment modalities can be used and help physicians manage diagnosis strategies and treatments. Purpose of this study is to develop a clinical decision support system for patients presenting to emergency department with the help of statistical machine learning.

primary_outcome.measure: Non fatal myocardial infarction, cardiac related death or coronary intervention in 30 days
primary_outcome.description: Patients will be screened for 30 days for Non fatal myocardial infarction, cardiac related death or coronary intervention (coronary angiogram, coronary artery bypass surgery)

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients presenting with acute coronary syndrome
arm_group.description: Patients presenting to emergency department with acute coronary syndrome

intervention.description: Study patients will be reviewed whether they will have coronary interventions in 30 days
intervention.arm_group_label: Patients presenting with acute coronary syndrome

study_pop.textblock: Patients presenting to emergency deparmtent with acute chest pain consistent with acute coronary syndrome will be included for analysis.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Presenting to emergency department with acute chest pain consistent with acute coronary syndrome
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with less than 18 years old
- Patients presenting with ST-segment elevation myocardial infarction
- Patients presenting with other causes of acute chest pain (pneumothorax, pulmonary -embolism, aortic dissection
- Decline to participate in study
